intro: Psychotria divergens var. grandifolia, commonly known as the giant psychotria, is a species native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family, characterized by its striking, showy flowers. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to several meters. Its leaves are usually elliptical or ovate, with a glossy green surface and prominent veins. The flowers are often clustered in terminal inflorescences, displaying vivid colors that attract pollinators such as birds and insects.
